episodes.title: 12 Questions about life and death - Understanding Jehovah Witness
episodes.description:
12 Answers to some of the most common questions about life and death. Understanding Jehovah Witness culture and beliefs. The clear explanations found in God's Word may surprise you, as interpreted by Jehovah's Witnesses. Why leave Jehovahs Witnesses? Excellent insight from five people who lived under their manipulation, coercion, control, and abuse.

Moments from the XJW Coming Out documentary series. 

00:00 Introduction to former cult member activism
00:12 Witness tells daughter to kill herself
00:22 Death is not a solution to problems
00:32 Use suicide to get into paradise
00:42 Jehovah's Witness abuse starts with baptism
00:55 Dedicated to "The Society," not god
01:05 Witnesses are coerced to shun family until death
01:15 Don't indoctrinate your kids
01:33 Life improves when you escape
01:44 Take your freedom, get out of trap
01:56 Prioritize freedom of thought
02:11 Guilt is their method of control, get out

Welcome to a gripping exploration of the human psyche with our latest video release – a compelling trailer for the highly anticipated cult series, XJW Coming Out, within the Witness Underground project. Delve into the enigmatic world of cults through riveting cult member Interviews, where survivors share their experience with Jehovah's Witness cultural norms related to death and stories that will leave you on the edge of your seat.

Unearth the truth behind extreme beliefs in our documentary series trailer that peels back the layers of the cult dogma, exposing the dark and often mysterious aspects of life within these closed societies. Join us as we tackle the challenging questions about life and death, unraveling the complexities of the Jehovah Witness faith in the aftermath of the Watchtower.

Discover firsthand accounts of those who have awakened from cult indoctrination, providing insight into what it's like growing up in a cult. Hear powerful narratives from cult survivors, as they courageously recount their journeys of escaping the clutches of extremist ideologies in our death cult series.

Explore the depths of the ExJW (Ex-Jehovah's Witness) experience, as individuals share their reasons for leaving the Jehovah's Witness life. Gain a deeper Understanding of Jehovah Witness beliefs about death.

Prepare yourself for how I survived a cult story, a slice of our series that confronts the most challenging aspects of cult life and the resolute spirit of those who managed to break free. Don't miss this opportunity to challenge preconceptions and embark on a thought-provoking journey into the world of extreme beliefs.

episodes.title: Devil Drinks Mocha - Story Editor and Novelist
episodes.description: Walmsley Krubeck did the heavy lifting of story editing and color for our feature documentary Witness Underground. In this episode we dive into the process, challenges, clashes, pressures, frustrations, and successes of working together in our first discussion after creating the film. She has since worked on several other films and also written her first novel. episodes.title: Former Bethel Elder Become a Blues Rocker
episodes.description: Former Elder in Jehovah's Witnesses, Gary Alt, was even a long-time "Bethelite," a worker at their world headquarters called Watchtower (a book publishing company masquerading as a religion). One of his contributions while there was cultural. He was asked to host a monthly music entertainment night at Bethel.Check out his songs:"Here are a handful of songs you might be interested in. The "still IN" songs variously have something to do with my exiting the JWs.[still IN]Falling Down vocal by Jaywayhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tl__9Y2BJq8Bleed For You vocal by Jaywayhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=USzsewK8WZsSpinhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8poJf5pTzxEWhatever (I knew this wasn't a good song when I did it, but I needed one more for my album Not For Sale To Minors and wanted it to be raw-sounding - deliberately done with the angst and minimalist values of John Lennon's early solo recordings)https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LjOZPqdskaA[OUT]Never Ending Always vocal by Lori Klein (written for my novel, Force of Will which used the pseudonym Tan Swiftwater - there's an interesting story to the song)https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JbRK0HbqMiMThis Holy Day vocal by post-JW Gayann from NYhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1OMPcoB9vL0Wake Up vocal by post-JW Emma-Jade Mechen, daughter of Shane, from New Zealandhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1LAjNwRe6GwAnything else you might be interested in may be found on Spotify by searching for "Gary Alt" and the following album names, all done when I was JW:-Tribute-(Not) For Sale To Minors-Beef Wellington and the Mad Cows - Masticated Bovine (joint project with JW friend Jayway when I was in)-Gift of Projection (EP that predicted Art of Survival but has only 2 songs in common with it)-Art of Survival (my best IMO)And a couple of relatively recent extra songs that are not on any album:-Shine a Light-The Moon is Broken Tonight-Western Lady - vocal by Rick Barth (YouTube only, not actually released)-Color Wind (demo only)Back in the Free World - vocal by Larry Hayden https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3g0Ch6YYMeg " - Written FOR the JWs back when I was in. I now reinterpret thWatch now:http://WitnessUnderground.comWatch & Support:https://vimeo.com/ondemand/witnessundergroundhttps://Patreon.com/WitnessUndergroundhttps://YouTube.com/@WitnessUndergroundStore:https://witness-underground-cult-documentary-release.pledgebox.com/preorderJump into our Discordhttps://discord.gg/WUp9c95rsXReach out directly: XJWdoc@gmail.com-Scott

episodes.title: Three former Jehovah's Witnesses give advice
episodes.description:
Watch & Support:
https://vimeo.com/ondemand/witnessunderground
https://Patreon.com/WitnessUnderground
https://YouTube.com/@WitnessUnderground
http://WitnessUnderground.com

Store:
https://witness-underground-cult-documentary-release.pledgebox.com/preorder

During production of Witness Underground documentary, we took a break between interviews and shooting, to have a former Jehovah's Witness meetup in Minneapolis. We ended up shooting these additional short interviews in the backyard during the event for the XJW Coming Out series as a bonus episode.

Three short interviews capture the diverse experiences of individuals who found the courage to question their upbringing in this "Apocalyptic cult" and, in doing so, discovered the strength to forge their own paths.

Listen to three former Witnesses, Jesse America, Erica Rae, and James Zimmerman who got out. They all describe what life was like inside, pressures they experienced, why they left, and their new world views. 

They dive into how they feel about this group looking back into their strange past.

Topics discussed:
Cognitive dissonance, conflict caused by religion, inner feelings as a witness, cultural norms within the cult, mis-education, becoming open-minded, disconnection with organized religion, different way to believe in god, atheism, enjoying life now rather than waiting on a higher power, reconnecting with grandparents and other family that were disconnected from because of this religions intolerance of non-members. Being honest about reality, achieving contentment in life through community, life passions, bond through powerful friendships. Family strength, success through education, first in family history to get a degree, feeling of freedom and access to pursue passions, showing love without judgement towards others.

Untethered from authoritarian control what did you do with your freedom?

Are you happier now?

What do you do now with your life?

What advice can you give to active members of the Jehovah's Witnesses?

"I'm so much happier not being in this religion anymore. I want that for them." Get out!

Prepare for a gripping 2-minute teaser that showcases the unshackled voices of brave souls who broke free from the dangerous clutches of the Jehovah's Witness death cult. Witness their courageous accounts of survival, resilience, and freedom as they expose the dark realities of the cult's harmful doctrines and extreme beliefs.

🚫 Shunned and Escaped: The Journey to Liberation 🚫

In this powerful teaser, join former Jehovah's Witness cult members who escaped and are now living full lives outside the confines of the cult. These brave individuals reflect on their experiences and share the emotional toll of being shunned by the community they once called family.

💀 Death Views and Heartless Remarks 💀

Listen as they discuss the harrowing death views ingrained within the cult, where one mother shockingly tells her daughter Miranda to take her own life rather than face a supposed Armageddon punishment by Jesus. Their chilling accounts reveal the psychological manipulation and control wielded by the cult's leaders, highlighting the danger posed to its members.

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Raising Free Thinkers: Breaking the Cycle 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦

Amidst the darkness, one father shares his journey of raising his children as free thinkers, encouraging them to explore their beliefs independently. His inspiring story is juxtaposed with footage of his punk rock band, Serial Killer Sunday School, where his voice echoes the message of breaking free from indoctrination and embracing individuality.

🔥 A Call to Action 🔥

These stories of survival and resilience will leave you moved and inspired. As they fight to protect themselves and others from the dangers of the Jehovah's Witness cult, they urge viewers to Subscribe here @WitnessUnderground to watch the XJW Coming Out Series and Witness Underground Documentary https://Patreon.com/WitnessUnderground. Together, let's amplify their voices and spread awareness about the dangers of this high-control death cult.

🌟 Join the Movement: Watch XJW Coming Out Series and Witness Underground Documentary to Empower Others to Break Free 🌟

Don't miss this captivating teaser that gives a glimpse into the lives of those who escaped the Jehovah's Witness death cult and found freedom. The XJW Coming Out Series and Witness Underground Documentary are calls to action, paving the way for change and helping others find their path to liberation. Stand with these survivors and join the fight against the darkness of the cult. 
Watch now! 🔔

After watching the thought-provoking documentary "Witness Underground," Three artists: an actor, a writer, and a musician engage in a profound conversation about their personal experiences with shunning and how they navigate through it. Join us as we explore the transformative power of art, music, therapy, movement, and meditation in coping while inside and healing after leaving a cult. Together, we'll embark on a remarkable exploration of consciousness and creativity.

Description:
In this compelling episode, we sit down with Gina Brown, Christopher of the band Scifidelic and Writer Brie Yarbrough in discussion with Scott Homan, Director of the award winning and eye-opening documentary "Witness Underground," which sheds light on artists who escaped a cult.

Together, we delve deep into their unique perspectives on shunning, drawing from their diverse experiences. We explore the profound impact of music, art, therapy, movement, and meditation as coping mechanisms during their time in the cult and as tools for healing after leaving.

Prepare to be inspired as we explore their creative endeavors, from dance and acting to crafting a new Streaming Series pitch and building on a successful TikTok channel. We'll also uncover the intriguing story behind their decades-long music project called Scifidelic, featuring a band member known as Caustic, who was once a high-ranking member at the world headquarters of the Jehovah's Witnesses. Discover how their music directly addresses the themes of faith and exiting from it.

Our guest, Gina, shares details about her exciting project—a series about the complexities of love, where an unlikely couple comes together amidst their vastly different worlds. Having experienced trauma within the Jehovah's Witness community, Gina incorporates her personal journey into the script, exploring the challenges of same-sex relationships and the harmful influence of the faith. We'll also touch upon the harrowing experiences of her sister-in-law, who faced life-threatening complications during childbirth due to the cult's ban on blood transfusions.

Additionally, we discuss Brie's upcoming book, which inspired her escape from the cult and provided solace and courage during her challenging journey. 

Together, we explore strategies for overcoming triggers, dealing with attachment, and addressing past baggage. Moreover, we delve into the diverse interpretations of the cult's teachings regarding the end of the world and the impact it had on our guests' lives.

Join us for this thought-provoking conversation that unveils the power of art, resilience, and self-discovery. Get ready to expand your consciousness and embark on a journey of inspiration and empowerment.
